page.title: 04EDUCATION IN EAKRING
page.content: Up to 1964 Eakring had its own school, the closing of it was very sad for the village. Having a school in the village the children grow up much closer which means everything to a community. In 1985 Eakring is very split educationally with children bussing to Bilsthorpe for the infants and juniors and Rufford Comp for seniors. A lot of parents prefer to send their children to other village schools such as Kneesall and Kirklington, or Private schools in Edingley and Wellow upto 11 yrs and to Minster School at Southwell, Nottingham High School and Privately at Worksop College. There is a combined churches Sunday School and a Youth Club for the teenages which help to bring the different groups together.
